meanings.definition: To hold or occupy (property) beyond the agreed upon period.
meanings.sent1: The tenant was overholding the apartment after the lease had ended.
meanings.sent2: She was warned about overholding the parking space for too long.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was overholding the nut, not willing to share with others.
meanings.sent4: His fear was overholding him, preventing him from taking any action.
meanings.sent5: The overholding of the trophy made him feel proud and accomplished.

meanings.definition: The act of holding or occupying (property) beyond the agreed upon period.
meanings.sent1: The overholding of the house caused legal issues between the parties.
meanings.sent2: His overholding of the office space led to disputes with the landlord.
meanings.sent3: The overholding of the cookie jar by the child made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her overholding of emotions finally burst out in tears.
meanings.sent5: The overholding of power by the dictator oppressed the people.
